alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 545 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coleman, or 11 miles south of Williamson, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimper, Phyllis, Raccoon, Fishtrap Lake, Meta, Zebulon and Chloe. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 3 and 13, and near mile marker 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
